# Read Self-Healing vs. nil table

```{r read_table, eval=FALSE}
####UNINFECTED AND SELF-HEALING

###Uploading the gene-level count datasets
Count_table_Sh_Nil <-read_excel("../Count_table_Sh_Nil.xlsx")
Count_table_Sh_Nil <- as.data.frame(Count_table_Sh_Nil)

rownames(Count_table_Sh_Nil) <- Count_table_Sh_Nil[["Genes"]]
Count_table_Sh_Nil[["Genes"]] <- NULL
```

# Creating a metadata data frame

```{r metadata}
###Creating the metada dataframe

samples <- as.vector(colnames(Count_table_Sh_Nil))
condition <- as.factor(c("Sh", "Sh", "Sh", "Sh", "Nil", "Nil"))
batch <- c("a", "a", "b", "b", "a", "b")
names(condition) <- colnames(Count_table_Sh_Nil)

metadataSh_Nil <- data.frame(condition, batch) #metadata

Count_table_Sh_Nil <- Count_table_Sh_Nil[, rownames(metadataSh_Nil)] #This is for ordering the columns in the count_table in a sequence based on the condition (Nil or Sh). Sometimes this is useful when the count table has many columns not ordered by the condition.
dim(Count_table_Sh_Nil)
```
#Creat the "expt" object based on hpgltools 

```{r}
Sh_Nil_expt.obj <- create_expt(metadata=metadataSh_Nil, count_dataframe=Count_table_Sh_Nil)
head(pData(Sh_Nil_expt.obj))

names(new_colors) <- c("Nil", "Sh")
```


# Filter low-counts and Differential expression analysis

```{r}

Count_table_Sh_Nil_Filtered_cbcb <- cbcb_filter_counts(Count_table_Sh_Nil, threshold = 1, min_samples = 2) #min samples corresponds to the number of samples in the smaller condition group
Count_table_Sh_Nil_Filtered <- Count_table_Sh_Nil_Filtered_cbcb$count_table

dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = Count_table_Sh_Nil_Filtered,
                              colData = metadataSh_Nil,
                              design= ~ condition)
dds$condition <- relevel(dds$condition, ref = "Nil")

dat  <- counts(dds)
dat1 <- as.matrix(log2(as.matrix(dat) + 1))
mod  <- model.matrix(~ condition, colData(dds))
mod0 <- mod[, 1]
n.sv <- sva::num.sv(dat1,mod,method="be")
svseq <- svaseq(as.matrix(dat), mod, mod0, n.sv = n.sv)

ddssva2 <- dds
ddssva2$SV1 <- svseq$sv[,1]
design(ddssva2) <- ~SV1 + condition
ddssva2 <- estimateSizeFactors(ddssva2)
ddssva2 <- estimateDispersions(ddssva2)
ddssva2 <- DESeq(ddssva2)
deseq_table <- as.data.frame(results(ddssva2))

deseq_table_sig_indixes <- deseq_table[["padj"]] <= 0.05
deseq_table_sig <- deseq_table[deseq_table_sig_indixes, ]
# deseq_table_sig_up_indexes <- deseq_table_sig[["log2FoldChange"]] >= 1.0
# deseq_table_sig_up <- deseq_table_sig[deseq_table_sig_up_indexes, ]
# dim(deseq_table_sig_up)
```
#Annotating the deseq_table

```{r switching_filters, eval=FALSE}

DE_table_Sh_Nil <- deseq_table_sig %>% dplyr::select(log2FoldChange, padj)  #Get rid of the columns I won't use
                              
Sh_Nil_ENTREZID <- bitr(row.names(DE_table_Sh_Nil), fromType="ENSEMBL", toType="ENTREZID", OrgDb="org.Hs.eg.db") # 20.9%  of input gene IDs are fail to map #corresponding to  out of 53

Sh_Nil_ENTREZID <- Sh_Nil_ENTREZID[!duplicated(Sh_Nil_ENTREZID$ENSEMBL), ] #0 duplicates #53 uniques

Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS <- gprofiler2::gconvert(Sh_Nil_ENTREZID$ENSEMBL, organism = "hsapiens", target = "ENSG",
                                                                   numeric_ns = "", mthreshold = Inf, filter_na = T) 

Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS <- Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS%>% dplyr::select(-input_number,
                                                                      -target_number, -target, -description, -namespace)
colnames(Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS) <- c("ENSEMBL", "SYMBOL")

Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS <- left_join(Sh_Nil_ENTREZID, Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS, by = "ENSEMBL")



Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados <- as.factor(made4::comparelists(row.names(DE_table_Sh_Nil), Sh_Nil_ENTREZID$ENSEMBL)$Set.Diff) # n = 14
Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS <- gprofiler2::gconvert(Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados, organism = "hsapiens", target = "ENSG",
                                                             numeric_ns = "", mthreshold = Inf, filter_na = T) #dim 14 7

Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS <- Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS %>% dplyr::select(-input_number,
                                                                          -target_number, -target, -description, -namespace)
colnames (Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS) <- c("ENSEMBL", "SYMBOL")

#The symbols are searched for the entrez id. I think the reason why some id ensembls are not directly associated with the entrezid but if its symbol is because the symbol is directly linked to the id of the ncbi
Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS_ENTREZIDs <- bitr(Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS$SYMBOL, fromType="SYMBOL", toType="ENTREZID", OrgDb="org.Hs.eg.db")  #33.33% of input gene IDs are fail to map


#Join Symbol with its corresponding entrezid and ensembl id (within the no Identified genes)
Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_SYMBOL_ENTREZIDs <- left_join(Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS, Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_NO_Identificados_SYMBOLS_ENTREZIDs, by = "SYMBOL")

Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_SYMBOL_ENTREZIDs <- Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_SYMBOL_ENTREZIDs[, c(1,3,2)]

#5. JOIN THE IDENTIFIER IDENTIFIED DIRECTLY BY THE ENSEMBL CODE AND IDENTIFIED IDENTIFIED ENTRY FROM THE SYMBOL

Sh_Nil_ENTREZIDs_Complete <- bind_rows(Sh_Nil_ENTREZID_SYMBOLS, Sh_Nil_ENSEMBLID_SYMBOL_ENTREZIDs) # 67    3

colnames(Sh_Nil_ENTREZIDs_Complete) <- c("GeneID", "ENTREZID", "SYMBOL")

#6. ADDING THE IDENTIFICATION TO THE CORRESPONDING ENSEMBL ID OF THE DATAFRAME OF THE GENES ON EXPRESSED

DE_table_Sh_Nil_2 <- cbind(GeneID = row.names(DE_table_Sh_Nil), DE_table_Sh_Nil)

DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated <- left_join(DE_table_Sh_Nil_2, Sh_Nil_ENTREZIDs_Complete, by = "GeneID") #67 5

#7 Add a column with the ids for kegg
DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated$kegg <- paste("hsa:", DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated$ENTREZID, sep = "")

#8 Add a column with the biotypes
library(bitops)
library(RCurl)
library(httr)
set_config( config( ssl_verifypeer = 0L ) )
library(swirl)

                   dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl", 
                   mirror = "useast")


Biotypes <- getBM(attributes=c('ensembl_gene_id', 'gene_biotype'),
      filters = 'ensembl_gene_id',
      values = DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated$GeneID,
      mart = ensembl, useCache = FALSE)

colnames(Biotypes) <- c('GeneID', 'Biotype')
#9 join the complete columns

DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated <- left_join(DE_table_Sh_Nil_annotated, Biotypes, by = "GeneID") #67 7
```
